alert.note: Alert for Greene; Perry; Stone (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 24 at 4:56PM CST until January 24 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Greene County in southeastern Mississippi... Perry County in southeastern Mississippi... Northwestern Stone County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 900 PM CST. * At 456 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. 3 to 4 inches of rain has fallen in the past 3 hours with additional thunderstorms expected to produce heavy rainfall over the next 1 to 2 hours. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wiggins, Richton, Perkinston, Beaumont, New Augusta, Oak Grove, Janice, Ferguson, Wingate, Barbara, Mahned, Little Creek, Belleville, Hintonville, McSwain, East Side, Bond, Brewer, Good Hope and Avera. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
